results.title: Birth of a port
results.creator_credit: William M. Carty, Harold Dews and Cinesound Movietone
results.brief_description: Discusses the development by the Maritime Services Board of deep-water facilities in Botany Bay, New South Wales, so that it can be used as a port for large shipping.

results.title: Birth of a monster
results.brief_description: Ocean Digger an off-shore oil drilling rig is the monster - ugly, unwieldy, gigantic, with a mammoth job to do in the off-shore search for oil and gas. Her construction, launching and fitting out at the Whyalla shipyards are shown in detail. Narrated by Terry Norris.

results.title: Birth of a giant
results.brief_description: Shows the final preparations for the launching by Queen Elizabeth of the 100,000 ton tanker British Admiral, the largest ship yet built in Europe. No other credits available.

results.title: Birth of a Florida key
results.brief_description: The origin and growth of the Islets making up the Florida Keys is explained. Mangrove bushes grow with amazing rapidity providing shelter to sea-birds, and assisting in the formation of marine life such as crabs, lobsters, and shell fish, all of which play their part in stabilising the growing islet. Rain helps reduce the salty content of the substratum until it is able to support other forms of plant life besides mangroves. Eventually insects and reptiles are soon represented and the ecological history of the island is complete.

results.title: Birth in the squatting position
results.brief_description: This film shows and discusses the method of giving birth in the squatting position as used in India. Such a position plays a significant role in facilitating labour and delivery, reducing neurological complications in the neonate resulting from birth trauma and in fostering initial maternal-infant attachment. No other credits available.

results.title: Birth control - How?
results.creator_credit: Frank Slinglarn, Stuart Schulberg, Ted Yates and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Discusses “the pill” and other birth control methods, and describes controlled experiment groups in Kentucky and in Puerto Rico. Examines some of the moral dimensions of birth control.

results.title: Birth and death of mountains
results.creator_credit: Paul Burnford, Film Associates and BFA Educational Media
results.brief_description: Shows the forces that wear down mountains and those that cause mountains to be formed. Uses drawings to demonstrate formations of fold mountains, new faultblock mountains and new dome mountains. Observes the mountain-flattening forces of glaciers, wind and water. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Birth (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Part five of the series, “The Family of Man” which sets out to compare family life in five different locations around the world. In this programme, pregnancy, birth and attitudes of women in all five places are examined, with a side-long look at different superstitions which reveal some strange stories. The programme asks, “Do women in peasant countries give birth with less pain and effort? And if so, why?”
